intro: Cnidium silaifolium, commonly known as the broad-leaf cowplant, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of central and southern China. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic herbs and vegetables. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its roots are often used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. Cnidium silaifolium is typically found in moist, shaded environments and is valued for both its ecological role and medicinal properties.
